metadata.name: GATE EE Power Electronics Problems
metadata.description: Problems modeled after GATE Electrical Engineering exam style with verified numerical answers
metadata.source: GATE exam pattern - Power Electronics section
metadata.verification_method: Analytical solutions verified with standard formulas

problems.problem_statement: A buck converter has an input voltage of 20V and output voltage of 8V. The duty cycle of the converter operating in continuous conduction mode is ___.

ground_truth.solution: For buck converter in CCM: D = Vout/Vin = 8/20 = 0.4

problems.problem_statement: A boost converter operates with input voltage 12V and output voltage 36V in CCM. The duty cycle is ___.

ground_truth.solution: For boost converter in CCM: D = 1 - Vin/Vout = 1 - 12/36 = 1 - 0.333 = 0.667

problems.problem_statement: A buck converter operates with Vin=24V, Vout=12V, Iout=5A, and switching frequency 50kHz in CCM. For 40% peak-to-peak inductor current ripple, the minimum inductance required in μH is ___.
A boost converter has Vin=10V, Vout=25V, Pout=50W operating at 100kHz. For 20% inductor current ripple, the minimum inductance in μH is ___.
A buck-boost converter produces an output voltage magnitude of 18V from a 12V input. The duty cycle is ___.
A buck converter with Vin=30V, Vout=15V, R=10Ω operates at 100kHz. The critical inductance for CCM/DCM boundary in μH is ___.
A buck converter with L=100μH, C=47μF operates with Vin=24V, Vout=12V at 100kHz. The peak-to-peak output voltage ripple in mV is ___.
A flyback converter with turns ratio 5:1 (primary:secondary) operates with Vin=100V, Vout=20V. Assuming CCM, the duty cycle is ___.

ground_truth.solution: For flyback: D = n×Vout/(Vin + n×Vout) = 5×20/(100 + 5×20) = 100/200 = 0.5, where n = Np/Ns = 5

problems.problem_statement: A forward converter with transformer ratio 8:1 operates with Vin=48V at D=0.4. The output voltage in volts is ___.
A SEPIC converter operates with Vin=15V and Vout=12V in CCM. The duty cycle is ___.
A half-bridge DC-DC converter with transformer ratio 10:1 operates with Vin=400V, D=0.45 (effective). The output voltage in volts is ___.

ground_truth.solution: For half-bridge: Vout = D×Vin/(2×n) = 0.45×400/(2×10) = 9V per half cycle × 2 = 18V (with full-wave rectification)

problems.problem_statement: A buck converter delivers 5V at 2A from a 12V supply. If the input current is 0.9A, the efficiency in percent is ___.
A boost converter with D=0.6 operates at 80kHz with Iout=2A. For 1% output voltage ripple (Vout=25V), the minimum capacitance in μF is ___.
A Cuk converter operates with Vin=20V and produces |Vout|=30V. The duty cycle is ___.

ground_truth.solution: For Cuk converter: |Vout|/Vin = D/(1-D), so 30/20 = D/(1-D), 1.5(1-D) = D, 1.5 = 2.5D, D = 0.6

problems.problem_statement: A phase-shifted full-bridge converter with n=6:1 operates with Vin=380V. For Vout=48V, the phase shift angle in degrees is ___.
